gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Region
Class WedgeRegion

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Region.Region
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Region.WedgeRegion
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class WedgeRegion
extends Region

This class is a specific region designated by three points. The WedgeRegion is used to pass points selected by a wedge region (in SelectionOverlay) from the view component to the viewer. Given the defining points of a region, this class can return all of the points inside the selected region. The defining points of the wedge are: p[0] = center pt of circle that arc is taken from p[1] = last mouse point/point at intersection of line and arc p[2] = reflection of p[1] p[3] = top left corner of bounding box around arc's total circle p[4] = bottom right corner of bounding box around arc's circle p[5].x = startangle, the directional vector in degrees p[5].y = degrees covered by arc. The large number of defining points replaces the work of recalculating information at each step of the region calculation. Like a EllipseRegion, this region may appear to be circular, but may actually be elliptical.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

WedgeRegion

public WedgeRegion(floatPoint2D[] dp)
Constructor - uses Region's constructor to set the defining points. The defining points are assumed to be in image values, where the input points are in (x,y) where (x = col, y = row ) form. The only exception is definingpoint[5] which holds angular (in degrees) values.

Parameters:
dp - - defining points of the wedge
Method Detail

getSelectedPoints

public java.awt.Point[] getSelectedPoints()
Get all of the points inside the wedge region. This method first determines if the point is in the ellipse, then uses angles to find if the points in the wedge region.

Specified by:
getSelectedPoints in class Region
Returns:
array of points included within the wedge region.

getDefiningPoints

public floatPoint2D[] getDefiningPoints(int coordsystem)
Get the world coordinate points used to define the geometric shape. This class must overload the base class method since angles must be ignored in the conversion.

Overrides:
getDefiningPoints in class Region
Parameters:
coordsystem - The coordinate system from which the defining points are taken from, either WORLD or IMAGE.
Returns:
array of points that define the region.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Display the region type with its defining points.

Specified by:
toString in class Region
Returns:
region type and defining points.

getRegionBounds

public CoordBounds getRegionBounds()
This method returns the rectangle containing the ellipse from which the wedge is taken from.

Specified by:
getRegionBounds in class Region
Returns:
The bounds of the WedgeRegion.
